page.title: 10A Tour of Esholt
page.content: {One of the inhabitants,a retired man {told us something about the village. The oldest building in the village is the Old Hall which was built in 1600 with stones from the old estate which was knocked down.The newest building is the extension to the village institute,built after the First World War.Even this is over 60 years old.The institute is set at the end of a road by an old toll house.The man we talked to has put chairs and tables in the institute and made it into a tea-room for visitors.He hasn't converted it or pulled anything out.He boils the water in an old copper heater which is now 60 years old.It is one of only three of this type in the country,and the only one left in working order.The institute is used for Dolly's playgroup in{Emmerdale Farm}the TV programme,and there is a place for an
